title: Strip normalize_paths()

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Someone else is requested to take over

body:
For now just a placeholder for a more complete description of the problem. Essentially, this is from a time where the Repo classes had to be considered part of the primary API. But now there are many discrepancies between the actual API (commands) and these function.

- decision what is an unexpected error vs an anticipated failure
- forced non-generator behavior
- ...

Ping @bpoldrack if you recall a full list of the relevant aspects, please add here.

Usage is limited to
- datalad/support/annexrepo.py
- datalad/support/gitrepo.py
- datalad/support/tests/test_gitrepo.py

Outside the tests `GitRepo` uses it for

- [ ] `add()`: to be gone #4872 
- [ ] `remove()`
- [ ] `get_last_commit_hexsha()`: used in 3 locations, if adjusted, the decorator could be dropped
- [ ] `_git_custom_command()`: to be gone #4850 

Usage in `AnnexRepo`:

- [ ] `get()`
- [ ] `add()`: to be gone #4872 
- [ ] `get_file_key()`
- [ ] `unlock()`
- [ ] `unannex()`
- [ ] `find()`
- [ ] `file_has_content()`
- [ ] `is_under_annex()`
- [ ] `drop()`
- [ ] `whereis()`
- [ ] `info()`
- [ ] `remove()`
- [ ] `is_available()`
- [ ] `_annex_custom_command()`
- [ ] `migrate_backend()`
- [ ] `get_file_backend()`
- [ ] `copy_to()`

There seems to be no need to tackle this all at once.
